content.raw: Regarding locking the GUI: The remote functions I've implemented in pull request #37 can set multiple globals at once, and do so in the main thread of runmanager, so that is not interruptable by user action. Acquiring a lock on the GUI would still be useful if you were wanting to get, set, and engage all in a row without being interrupted, is that the sort of thinking you had in mind? I wonder if this is of limited usefulness and if a 'we are all adults here, it is up to you whether to mess with runmanager during optimisation' attitude might be ok.
